etymology.description: 一(一) (yī, "one") stacked in sequence -> representation of the number "four"
etymology.interpretation: The character 亖 is formed by stacking the character 一(一) (yī, "one") four times in a sequence to visually represent the concept of the number four.

examples.pinyin: Tā zài xuānzhǐ shàng xiě xià sǐ.
examples.english: He wrote the character 'four lines' on rice paper.

examples.chinese: 古人喜爱运用亖(亖)，刻画简朴之美(刻畫簡樸之美)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén xǐ'ài yùnyòng sǐ，kèhuà jiǎnpǔ zhī měi.
examples.english: Ancients loved to use 'four lines' to depict the beauty of simplicity.
